questions.question: What is the purpose of a light board?

choices.answer: control the location
controls the kind of light to use
for intensity reasons
all of the above

questions.question: The purpose of a light plot is..

choices.answer: Director's communication with their ideas on light placement
There's no purpose, it's just another fancy term used
To shine a light on certain areas designed for a show
A series of testing lights over a long period of time
Back of stage
Middle of stage
Front of stage
Center of stage
lights that create a circular beam to focus on certain parts
profiles with decorative lights around them
document background information of lights
none of the above

questions.question: What is a gobo and the purpose of having a gobo?

choices.answer: piece of metal that slides in front of light to mask shadows
A stand holder for lights
a slang used as cues for lighting
Person who deals with tech and controls the lighting changes
lights that are used to light up any part of stage
lights that control the sides of the stages
barrier doors to protect the equipment
lights that put a spot on each main character

fresnel
profile

questions.question: the difference between a blackout and a blueout is..

choices.answer: blueout completely makes stage black, black shows blacklight
blackout completely makes stage black, blue shows blacklight
there is no difference because blue and black are just color
blackout is a sign to passout, blue is just a side affect

only at certain scenes intended based on directors choice
true
there is no such thing as floodlights and borders
